title: Language Education Design Applying Constructivist-Based Philosophy Learning Theory

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of foundational language education theories and basic instructional design concepts
context.additional_context: PBL (Project-Based Learning) course designed for pre-service teachers to apply philosophical learning theories to language education design, emphasizing collaboration and material creation via personal devices.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze language learning theories from a constructivist perspective and apply them to instructional design frameworks.
Learners develop two or more PBL (Project-Based Learning) scenarios based on philosophical learning theories (e.g., Dewey, Piaget, Vygotsky).
Learners can evaluate the linkage between theory and practice through project outcomes and propose improvement strategies.

resources: Digital Collaboration Tools (e.g., Google Workspace, Notion)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
